text: I want to go to the hospital for suicide ideation but it s so overwhelming doing that when it shouldn t be   My experience I ve been to the ER   times for suicide ideation and if I had to explain how it was in one word  it would be  overwhelming   First off  I m placed in a hospital bed  to be then moved to the ER hallway  the hallway for people that have used self harm  threatened suicide and or are mentally unstable  Now  I don t really care that I m laying in a bed  in a hallway for people that are at risk of killing themselves  but I could see how embarrassing it can be for people  Anyways  you have to lay in your bed until a nurse checks up on you  possibly checks your vitals and or a psychiatrist might see you  but since the hospital is typically crowded  it can take up to   days for him or her to see you The   times I ve been there  you have to wait in your bed for at least   whole day  or night  to be then placed in the adult psychward  One time I had to wait   days until I was placed there  That means  I had to lay in my bed  in the hallway  with very bright lights  meaning it s very hard to sleep  and not to mention it s loud in the hallway and still pretty loud at night  It s complete torture if you ask me  I don t think I will ever want to go there again  regardless of how suicidal I am  I d rather kill myself in my own comfort I don t know how your hospital works but this was the layout  https imgur com a Mj nfs   keep in mind  the hospital beds in the rooms were meant for physical dangerous patients and or people that need to be assessed by a psychiatrist
summary: Suicide ideation is overwhelming. I want to go to the hospital for suicide ideation but it's overwhelming. In the ER, I was placed in a hospital bed and then moved to the ER hallway for people that have used self harm, threatened suicide or are mentally unstable. It can take up to days for a nurse to check up on you and place you in the adult ward.
cleaned: suicide ideation overwhelming want hospital suicide ideation overwhelming place hospital bed move hallway people self harm threaten suicide mentally unstable day nurse check place adult ward

text: no logic in thisI am the black sheep from a family of high achievers  I am alone every day  Yes I do go to work but I m the boss of a team  There is this invisible barrier to making friends with coworkers  It is frustrating to spend all day with people   witnessing them having more detailed animate conversations with each other then they have ever had with me  Yes I have tried inviting them to hangout  and a few times people actually showed up  yet I am never included in their weekend plans  etc  I only receive a personal call about once a week  from my father  I live alone  and due to current financial circumstances I am hesitant to uproot  In January my partner left  ending a   year relationship  It is what it is    These last few months I have been working on myself  got a promotion  pushed myself to be social  attended   therapy sessions  got medicated  did CBT  etc  And despite all my efforts I am no further ahead psychologically  I ve tried to get out dating again  Lots of phone numbers  tinder convos  snaps  Never an in person meeting  Some have ghosted from text conversations  like  wtf please reply   of course I wouldn t type that irl  I ve even started to open up to  friends  about this depression   not my first major depressive episode  Maybe I ve just been depressed constantly  but at a lower intensity  people dont like seeing weakness  After mentioning suicidal thoughts  I had one  friend  yell at me  don t ever  talk like that to me again  So I just can t shake the idea that nobody will be impacted in their day to day by my exit  Yes  a few people will be sad but not many would show to my funeral  Even less would remember   months later  It wont get better for me  As Darwin would say  Nature has selected me out of existence  I am ashamed for failing to reach my  full potential
summary: There is an invisible barrier to making friends with coworkers at work. My partner left me in January after a year of a relationship. I have been depressed for the last few months. I am ashamed for not being able to reach my full potential.

text: Suicide seems inevitable to me It will be a ways off honestly  I posted a couple days ago about how I would like to finish Game of Thrones   Maybe life can hopefully get better by then  I doubt it  The year I have had has not let up at all on kicking me down  This isn t just a matter of perspective  I have tried to have a good outlook even as life kept shoving it s disgusting lemons down my throat  Eventually I just started to believe that it will never get better  The people who have hurt me seem completely oblivious which is their right I suppose  But some of them outright confronted me with things they didn t need to and it sent me on this spiral  After one thing happened last month I don t know if I truly care if things get better  They need to get better in a particular way or I just don t think I can make it through life  I m   and if I feel this much pain right now I don t want to even imagine the kind of pain I could feel by the time I m   I was reminded of the Doctor Who episode Vincent and the Doctor and its portrayal of mental health  That episode moved me back in times when I felt mentally stable but now thinking about it I can relate very much to how Vincent was portrayed and the take away at the end when he is still dead when the doctor returns to the present  The Doctor muses that  Good things don t always soften the bad  I feel like that is the state I am in now  Even the best things that happen to me now just feel like nothing compared to the pain of all the bad that this year in particular has brought me  Thank you for reading if you have read this far  Just needed to get some thoughts out
summary: This year has been very difficult for him. He is depressed and suicidal. He would like to end the Game of Thrones series. He was reminded of the Doctor Who episode Vincent and the Doctor and its portrayal of mental health. He can relate to it.
cleaned: year difficult depressed suicidal like end game throne series remind doctor episode vincent doctor portrayal mental health relate
